key_points: Brandon Lee's family expresses sadness and frustration following the fatal shooting of Halyna Hutchins on the 'Rust' set.
Cinematographer Halyna Hutchins was killed and director Joel Souza wounded by a misfired gun handled by Alec Baldwin.
Shannon Lee, Brandon's sister, advocates for banning real guns on film sets, emphasizing modern special effects negate the need.
The family is revisiting their own tragedy; Brandon Lee was fatally wounded in 1993 on the set of 'The Crow'.
Shannon Lee stresses the importance of following safety rules on sets, citing negligence in her brother's death.
The Lee family supports an industry-wide change to prevent future tragedies involving firearms.
Alec Baldwin expressed shock and sadness over the incident, and is cooperating with the authorities.
The film and entertainment community has shown support on social media for banning real guns from sets.
Shannon Lee highlighted the outpouring of love for her brother as bittersweet but hopes it leads to meaningful change.
The Lee family's stance comes amidst a broader industry and public discourse on safety protocols and the use of firearms on film sets.
spokespersons: Alec Baldwin (Actor involved in the 'Rust' shooting incident)
